intro: Serapias autumnalis, commonly known as the autumn sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with prominent, showy petals that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky soils. Serapias autumnalis is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and limestone areas.
